abstracts.cdata!:
The Potash Project consists of the
            construction of a trial dike and detailed field work, as
            well as extensive engineering and marketing studies to
            establish the technical and commerical parameters of potash
            production from Dead Sea brine via solar evaporation. It
            includes: (a) the design, construction, supervision, and
            testing of a trial dike on which the solar evaporation
            system could be based; and (b) based on the successful
            performance of the trial dike, the pilot work determining
            the optimal means of harvesting carnallite and producing
            high grade potash, a feasibility study would be carried out
            to determine capital and operating costs, market potential,
            and financial and economic returns.
